title.narrative: Ongoing Support to IAWG Training Partnership Initiative Partners

description.narrative: Engage new and maintain preexisting partnerships with training institutes and research partners from crises prone and affected countries and continue to support dissemination and uptake of existing clinical refresher training modules.

title.narrative: IAWG TPI-website regularly updated with new modules and the IAWG community of practice maintained.

description.narrative: COVID-19 hub developed on IAWG website Weekly newsletter of COVID-19 resources circulated to IAWG listserv

comment.narrative: The IAWG-TPI microsite has 226 subscribers and 94 participants. It is updated regularly, but is awaiting the IAWG Content Manager to further revise and make more user friendly.

The IAWG-TPI website is continually updated to include relevant trainings and training materials on SRHR, and new users of the community of practice are regularly approved. The IAWG-TPI's existing modules, a guidance note, and a budget template for planning purposes have been added. New IAWG-TPI modules and resources will be added as soon as they are finalized.
The IAWG-TPI website was redesigned and the statistics have changed.

title.narrative: The IAWG-TPI is engaging with existing and fostering new international and local partners to support the implementation of the IAWG-TPI training resources, operational research, the Steering Committee, and/or in technical consultations.

description.narrative: Dissemination of S-CORT materials and strengthening of the IAWG-TPI • BEmONC module updated • Clinical Management of Survivors of Sexual Violence module updated

comment.narrative: In this quarter, the IAWG-TPI Steering Committee is comprised of members from Ipas, CARE, UNFPA, Jhpiego, WRC, and IRC. The IAWG-TPI released an article in Reproductive Health Matters on the S-CORT modules, which was written in partnership with the Juba College of Nursing and Midwifery, the Family Planning Association of Nepal, and Institut Africain de Santé Publique, and in-country partner research institutes in South Sudan, Nepal, and Burkina Faso.
The IAWG-TPI has newly engaged in a partnership with the WHO to pilot the MISP to CSRH toolkit and received a new steering committee member organization.

The TPI has two new steering committee members: Laerdal Global Health and Pathfinder. Additionally, IAWG TPI has been collaborating with UNFPA Bangladesh and UNFPA DRC through the MISP to CSRH pilots.
